alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued December 27 at 3:55AM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Very Cold Tonight in Interior Northern California... .A cold weather pattern is forecast to bring several cold nights and early mornings to interior Northern California for much of this week. The coldest night is expected to be tonight when low temperatures are forecast to drop to near or below freezing in urban areas and plummet into the 20s in rural areas including the lower foothills. Although this stretch of cold weather is expected to result in low temperatures from 5 to 12 degrees below normal, widespread record low temperatures are not expected. A weather system is expected to spread cloud cover over the area Wednesday morning that will keep temperatures from plummeting into the 20s. However, it will be cold enough for snow in the Northern Sacramento Valley and surrounding Foothills, while rain showers are expected in the Southern Sacramento Valley, Northern San Joaquin Valley and Delta region. The coldest temperatures Thursday morning are forecast to be limited to the Northern Sacramento Valley and nearby foothills due to clearing skies. ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Below freezing temperatures with lows dropping into the 20s in outlying areas, and low 30s in urban areas. * WHERE...Northern and Central Sacramento Valley, Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County, Motherlode, Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley and Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County. * WHEN...From late tonight through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
